solution_line_template: The first fisherman will catch {first_fisherman_rate}*{season_days} = <<{first_fisherman_rate}*{season_days}={first_fisherman_total}>>{first_fisherman_total} fish during the season.

The second fisherman catch {second_fisherman_rate1}*{days1} + {second_fisherman_rate2}*{days2} = <<{second_fisherman_rate1}*{days1}+{second_fisherman_rate2}*{days2}={second_fisherman_first_90}>>{second_fisherman_first_90} fish during the first 90 days of the season.

Then, during the remaining {season_days} - {days_first_two_periods} = {remaining_days} days of the season, the second fisherman will can an additional {second_fisherman_rate3}*{remaining_days} = <<{second_fisherman_rate3}*{remaining_days}={second_fisherman_remaining}>>{second_fisherman_remaining} fish.

Thus, the second fisherman will catch a total of {second_fisherman_first_90} + {second_fisherman_remaining} = <<{second_fisherman_first_90}+{second_fisherman_remaining}={second_fisherman_total}>>{second_fisherman_total} fish.

Therefore, the second fisherman will catch {second_fisherman_total} - {first_fisherman_total} = <<{second_fisherman_total}-{first_fisherman_total}={difference}>>{difference} more fish than the first fisherman at the end of the season.
